articles.headline: Elon Musk Accuses Tesla Employee of Sabotage
articles.snippet: In an email to workers, he said the operation was “quite extensive and damaging” at a time when the automaker was scrambling to ramp up production.
articles.abstract: In an email to workers, he said the operation was “quite extensive and damaging” at a time when the automaker was scrambling to ramp up production.
articles.lead_paragraph: In scrambling to ramp up production of its Model 3 electric car, Tesla has run into trouble with robots and automated machinery, a need for more workers and a shortage of battery packs.

articles.headline: Trump’s Trade War Spooks Markets as White House Waits for China to Blink
articles.snippet: The administration, threatening tariffs on as much as $450 billion worth of goods, believes Beijing has more to lose. Companies, investors and markets are increasingly worried.
articles.abstract: The administration, threatening tariffs on as much as $450 billion worth of goods, believes Beijing has more to lose. Companies, investors and markets are increasingly worried.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s threat to impose tariffs on almost every Chinese product that comes into the United States intensified the possibility of a damaging trade war, sending stock markets tumbling on Tuesday and drawing a rebuke from retailers, tech companies and manufacturers.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Moves to End Trump’s Family Separation Policy, but Can’t Agree How
articles.snippet: But President Trump rejected one proposal, by Senator Ted Cruz, to end the separations by increasing personnel in immigration courts, suggesting that many of those judges could be corrupt.
articles.abstract: But President Trump rejected one proposal, by Senator Ted Cruz, to end the separations by increasing personnel in immigration courts, suggesting that many of those judges could be corrupt.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congressional Republicans moved on Tuesday to defuse an escalating political crisis over immigration, but failed to agree on how to end President Trump’s policy of separating immigrant children from parents who cross illegally into the United States.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: Fox News Faces Criticism of Family Separation Coverage From Inside Murdoch Empire
articles.snippet: Steve Levitan, the creator of “Modern Family,” and the film director Paul Feig each expressed disgust with how the news network’s coverage of the Trump administration’s border security policy.
articles.abstract: Steve Levitan, the creator of “Modern Family,” and the film director Paul Feig each expressed disgust with how the news network’s coverage of the Trump administration’s border security policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, the Murdoch family has been able to maintain a separation between its Fox News network and its sprawling entertainment empire.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Tiffany Hsu

articles.headline: Where a Taboo Is Leading to the Deaths of Young Girls
articles.snippet: In western Nepal, women are banished from their homes every month when they get their periods. They are considered polluted, and many die as a result.
articles.abstract: In western Nepal, women are banished from their homes every month when they get their periods. They are considered polluted, and many die as a result.
articles.lead_paragraph: TURMAKHAND, Nepal — Not long ago, in rural western Nepal, Gauri Kumari Bayak was the spark of her village. Her strong voice echoed across the fields as she husked corn. When she walked down the road at a brisk clip, off to lead classes on birth control, many admired her self-confidence.

articles.headline: Microsoft Employees Protest Work With ICE, as Tech Industry Mobilizes Over Immigration
articles.snippet: Microsoft workers objected to the company’s work with immigration authorities, part of a wave of outrage over the Trump administration’s immigration policy.
articles.abstract: Microsoft workers objected to the company’s work with immigration authorities, part of a wave of outrage over the Trump administration’s immigration policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In an open letter posted to Microsoft’s internal message board on Tuesday, more than 100 employees protested the software maker’s work with Immigration and Customs Enforcement and asked the company to stop working with the agency, which has been separating migrant parents and their children at the border with Mexico.

articles.headline: Disability Applications Plunge as the Economy Strengthens
articles.snippet: Fewer people are seeking and receiving Social Security disability benefits, reversing a long trend that had worried lawmakers about fraud and abuse.
articles.abstract: Fewer people are seeking and receiving Social Security disability benefits, reversing a long trend that had worried lawmakers about fraud and abuse.
articles.lead_paragraph: The number of Americans seeking Social Security disability benefits is plunging, a startling reversal of a decades-old trend that threatened the program’s solvency. It is the latest evidence of a stronger economy pulling people back into the job market or preventing workers from being sidelined in the first place.

articles.headline: As Greece Ends a Decade of Bailouts, Problems Linger for Europe
articles.snippet: European officials are eager to paint Greece as a comeback story. But troubles in nearby Italy show that the euro’s issues have not been laid to rest.
articles.abstract: European officials are eager to paint Greece as a comeback story. But troubles in nearby Italy show that the euro’s issues have not been laid to rest.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Greece prepares to emerge from one of the region’s most wrenching economic periods, its creditors are drawing up plans to ensure it is never a problem for the rest of Europe again.

articles.headline: How Tech Companies Conquered America’s Cities
articles.snippet: Elon Musk is drilling tunnels, electric scooters command the sidewalks, and Amazon is throwing its weight around in Seattle. Welcome to the technocapitalist metropolis of the future.
articles.abstract: Elon Musk is drilling tunnels, electric scooters command the sidewalks, and Amazon is throwing its weight around in Seattle. Welcome to the technocapitalist metropolis of the future.
articles.lead_paragraph: I’m not saying America’s cities are turning into dystopian technocapitalist hellscapes in which corporations operate every essential service and pull every civic string.

articles.headline: Fewer Births Than Deaths Among Whites in Majority of U.S. States
articles.snippet: The pattern first started more than a decade ago. But lagging fertility rates and rising white mortality rates have sped demographic change.
articles.abstract: The pattern first started more than a decade ago. But lagging fertility rates and rising white mortality rates have sped demographic change.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Deaths now outnumber births among white people in more than half the states in the country, demographers have found, signaling what could be a faster-than-expected transition to a future in which whites are no longer a majority of the American population.

articles.headline: Disney Ups Its Bid for 21st Century Fox to $71.3 Billion
articles.snippet: Fox agrees to deal as Rupert Murdoch says he prefers to sell the company to Disney. Will Comcast make a counteroffer?
articles.abstract: Fox agrees to deal as Rupert Murdoch says he prefers to sell the company to Disney. Will Comcast make a counteroffer?
articles.lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company sharply increased its offer for 21st Century Fox on Wednesday, as it looks to win a bidding war with Comcast for Rupert Murdoch’s entertainment conglomerate.

articles.headline: Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Name C.E.O. for Health Initiative
articles.snippet: Dr. Atul Gawande, a Harvard professor, surgeon and writer, will lead the initiative formed to provide health care for the companies’ employees.
articles.abstract: Dr. Atul Gawande, a Harvard professor, surgeon and writer, will lead the initiative formed to provide health care for the companies’ employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s a marquee name for a marquee venture.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson and Tiffany Hsu

articles.headline: Horrific Details on Syria Chemical Attacks Left Out, for Now, From U.N. Report
articles.snippet: An early draft of a report on the recapture of rebel-held Damascus suburbs contained information about chemical attacks omitted from the final version.
articles.abstract: An early draft of a report on the recapture of rebel-held Damascus suburbs contained information about chemical attacks omitted from the final version.
articles.lead_paragraph: At least twice this year, the Syrian military fired Iranian-made artillery shells filled with a chlorine-like substance that oozed poison slowly, giving victims just a few minutes to escape.
articles.byline: By Rick Gladstone and Maggie Haberman
